items.title: North Korea's Kim decorates 'heroes' who fought for Russia against Ukraine
items.standfirst: North Korea's leader Kim Jong-un led an emotional ceremony decorating troops who fought against Ukrainian soldiers in Russia's Kursk region and honouring those who died, images released by state media on Friday showed. In a speech, Kim praised the "admirable" troops who had lost their lives facing "life-and-death war in the foreign country", state media reported.
items.content: North Korea's leader Kim Jong-un led an emotional ceremony decorating troops who fought against Ukrainian soldiers in Russia's Kursk region and honouring those who died, images released by state media on Friday showed. In a speech, Kim praised the "admirable" troops who had lost their lives facing "life-and-death war in the foreign country", state media reported.

North Korean troops were deployed to assist Russia in its war efforts.
The state news agency KCNA reported on the event and Kim's speech.

items.title: Thai court acquits ex-Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra of royal defamation charge
items.standfirst: Thailand's former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra was acquitted of a royal defamation charge by a court on Friday, in a case that could have sent him to prison for up to 15 years.

items.title: Thailand former PM cleared of royal insult charge but Shinawatra dynasty’s fate still hangs in balance
items.standfirst: Lese-majesty case against Thaksin Shinawatra is dismissed, but his daughter Paetongtarn will hear next week if she will be removed as prime minsterA criminal court in Thailand has dismissed a case accusing former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra of defaming the monarchy, the first of three court cases that could decide the fate of one of the country’s prominent political families.Thaksin was accused of insulting the monarchy during an interview with South Korean newspaper Chosun Ilbo in 2015. Continue reading...
items.content: Lese-majesty case against Thaksin Shinawatra is dismissed, but his daughter Paetongtarn will hear next week if she will be removed as prime minsterA criminal court in Thailand has dismissed a case accusing former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra of defaming the monarchy, the first of three court cases that could decide the fate of one of the country’s prominent political families.Thaksin was accused of insulting the monarchy during an interview with South Korean newspaper Chosun Ilbo in 2015. Continue reading...

items.title: Thai court clears ex-PM Thaksin of royal defamation charges
items.standfirst: A Thai court on Friday cleared former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra of royal defamation charges, saying there was not enough evidence to prove wrongdoing. The case stemmed from decades-old remarks Thaksin made in South Korean media that prosecutors said violated Thailand's strict laws prohibiting insults against its royal family.
items.content: A Thai court on Friday cleared former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra of royal defamation charges, saying there was not enough evidence to prove wrongdoing. The case stemmed from decades-old remarks Thaksin made in South Korean media that prosecutors said violated Thailand's strict laws prohibiting insults against its royal family.

items.title: Erik Menendez's parole denied three decades after parents' murder
items.standfirst: Erik Menendez was denied parole on Thursday, the California Board of Parole Hearings said, three decades after being jailed for life – along with his brother Lyle – for killing their parents in their Beverly Hills home in 1989. The pair say they acted in self-defense after years of emotional and sexual abuse at the hands of a tyrannical father.
items.content: Erik Menendez was denied parole on Thursday, the California Board of Parole Hearings said, three decades after being jailed for life – along with his brother Lyle – for killing their parents in their Beverly Hills home in 1989. The pair say they acted in self-defense after years of emotional and sexual abuse at the hands of a tyrannical father.

items.title: California parole board denies release of Erik Menendez
items.standfirst: Panel declines to grant parole to Menendez, convicted over parents’ deaths, while brother Lyle faces hearing on FridayThe California board of parole hearings denied the release of Erik Menendez, on Thursday who has spent nearly 30 years in prison since he was convicted with his brother in the shooting deaths of their parents.Erik and Lyle Menendez were sentenced in 1996 to life in prison for fatally shooting their father, Jose Menendez, and mother, Kitty Menendez, in their Beverly Hills mansion in 1989. They were 18 and 21 at the time. While defense attorneys argued the brothers acted out of self-defense after years of sexual abuse by their father, prosecutors said the brothers killed their parents for a multimillion-dollar inheritance. Continue reading...

They were 18 and 21 at the time. While defense attorneys argued the brothers acted out of self-defense after years of sexual abuse by their father, prosecutors said the brothers killed their parents for a multimillion-dollar inheritance. clusters.title: Colombia hit by deadly guerrilla attacks, at least 18 killed
clusters.neutral_headline: Deadly Guerrilla Attacks in Colombia Kill Eighteen

items.title: Colombia hit by deadly guerrilla attacks, at least 18 killed
items.standfirst: Two attacks by dissident guerrilla groups in Colombia killed 18 people and injured dozens on Thursday. A truck bomb struck Cali, while a drone downed a police helicopter at a northern coca farm, worsening the country’s worst security crisis in decades and threatening fragile peace efforts ahead of next year’s elections.
items.content: Two attacks by dissident guerrilla groups in Colombia killed 18 people and injured dozens on Thursday. A truck bomb struck Cali, while a drone downed a police helicopter at a northern coca farm, worsening the country’s worst security crisis in decades and threatening fragile peace efforts ahead of next year’s elections.

items.title: In Colombia, two separate guerilla attacks kill 18
items.standfirst: Two attacks by dissident guerrilla groups killed 18 people and injured dozens in Colombia on Thursday. A truck bomb struck Cali, killing six and wounding more than 60, while a drone brought down a police helicopter at a coca farm in the north. The violence deepens Colombia’s worst security crisis in decades and threatens fragile peace efforts ahead of next year’s elections. FRANCE 24'- Juan Pablo Lucumi has more from our offices in Bogota.
items.content: Two attacks by dissident guerrilla groups killed 18 people and injured dozens in Colombia on Thursday. A truck bomb struck Cali, killing six and wounding more than 60, while a drone brought down a police helicopter at a coca farm in the north. The violence deepens Colombia’s worst security crisis in decades and threatens fragile peace efforts ahead of next year’s elections. FRANCE 24'- Juan Pablo Lucumi has more from our offices in Bogota.

items.title: At least 18 killed and dozens injured in separate Colombia attacks

items.title: Netanyahu pushes ahead with Gaza takeover
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel is moving ahead with its planned takeover of Gaza City. He also signalled willingness to negotiate the release of Israeli hostages, but his remarks undermined hopes for a ceasefire deal proposed by Arab nations and accepted by Hamas earlier this week.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel is moving ahead with its planned takeover of Gaza City. He also signalled willingness to negotiate the release of Israeli hostages, but his remarks undermined hopes for a ceasefire deal proposed by Arab nations and accepted by Hamas earlier this week.

items.title: Netanyahu says Israel will begin ceasefire talks with Hamas
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he is willing to restart ceasefire talks with Hamas in exchange for the remaining hostages being released. This comes as Israel launched a ground offensive to take control of Gaza City, calling up 60,000 additional reservists. Protests erupted over news of the most recent offensive, with many hostage families saying this only endangered those still left in Gaza.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he is willing to restart ceasefire talks with Hamas in exchange for the remaining hostages being released. This comes as Israel launched a ground offensive to take control of Gaza City, calling up 60,000 additional reservists. Protests erupted over news of the most recent offensive, with many hostage families saying this only endangered those still left in Gaza.

items.title: Netanyahu announces return to Gaza ceasefire negotiations
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said renewed ceasefire negotiations would go “hand in hand” with the planned expansion of military operations to take full control of Gaza City.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said renewed ceasefire negotiations would go “hand in hand” with the planned expansion of military operations to take full control of Gaza City.

ai_summary: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu is willing to restart ceasefire talks.
Talks would be in exchange for the release of remaining hostages.
Israel launched a ground offensive to take control of Gaza City.
60,000 additional reservists were called up.
Protests erupted over the offensive, with hostage families concerned.

clusters.title: Egypt unveils 2,000-year-old sunken city
clusters.neutral_headline: Egypt unveils 2,000-year-old sunken city:

items.title: Egypt unveils 2,000-year-old sunken city
items.standfirst: Egypt on Thursday unveiled parts of a sunken city submerged beneath waters off the coast of Alexandria, revealing buildings, artefacts and an ancient dock, all dating back over 2,000 years.
items.content: Egypt on Thursday unveiled parts of a sunken city submerged beneath waters off the coast of Alexandria, revealing buildings, artefacts and an ancient dock, all dating back over 2,000 years.

items.title: Egypt reveals 2,000-year-old sunken artefacts
items.standfirst: Statues and ancient artefacts dating back more than 2,000 years have been retrieved from a sunken city.
items.content: Statues and ancient artefacts dating back more than 2,000 years have been retrieved from a sunken city.

ai_summary: Egypt unveiled parts of a sunken city off the coast of Alexandria.
The city dates back over 2,000 years.
Buildings, artifacts, and an ancient dock were revealed.
Statues and ancient artifacts were retrieved.
The discovery provides insights into ancient history.

items.title: She's cared for America's elderly for decades. Trump wants her gone by Sept. 8
items.standfirst: The Trump administration has moved to end temporary protected status for immigrants from Honduras and other countries. Among them are health care workers tending to older and disabled people.
items.content: The Trump administration has moved to end temporary protected status for immigrants from Honduras and other countries. Among them are health care workers tending to older and disabled people.(Image credit: Jackie Lay)

ai_summary: The Trump administration is ending temporary protected status for immigrants from Honduras and other countries.
Some of these immigrants work in healthcare, caring for elderly and disabled individuals.
Aurora, a Honduran nurse, left her home country seeking a better future for her daughters.
She has worked in the United States for decades, caring for elderly patients.
The administration's move could impact the healthcare workforce.

clusters.title: After a few chilly years, the real estate market is looking a little warmer
clusters.neutral_headline: Real Estate Market Shows Signs of Improvement

items.title: After a few chilly years, the real estate market is looking a little warmer
items.standfirst: High mortgage rates cooled home sales over the last few years. But data released this week shows signs that things may be thawing a bit. (Image credit: Joe Raedle)
items.content: High mortgage rates cooled home sales over the last few years. But data released this week shows signs that things may be thawing a bit. (Image credit: Joe Raedle)

items.title: After a few chilly years, the real estate market is looking a little warmer

items.content: High mortgage rates cooled home sales over the last few years. But data released this week shows signs that things may be thawing a bit.(Image credit: Joe Raedle)

ai_summary: High mortgage rates previously cooled the real estate market.
Data released this week suggests a potential thawing in the market.
The market had experienced a period of slower sales.
The recent data indicates a possible shift in trends.
The change could signal a recovery in the housing sector.

clusters.title: Rapper Lil Nas X arrested and taken to hospital after wandering LA street in underwear
clusters.neutral_headline: Lil Nas X Arrested After Incident in Los Angeles

items.title: Rapper Lil Nas X arrested and taken to hospital after wandering LA street in underwear
items.standfirst: US rapper Lil Nas X has been arrested and taken to hospital after being found walking in his underwear on a Los Angeles street and allegedly charging at officers and punching one.
items.content: US rapper Lil Nas X has been arrested and taken to hospital after being found walking in his underwear on a Los Angeles street and allegedly charging at officers and punching one.

items.title: Lil Nas X arrested and taken to hospital after wandering LA streets in underwear
items.standfirst: The LAPD allege the singer "charged" at them and was placed under arrest on suspicion of battery.
items.content: The LAPD allege the singer "charged" at them and was placed under arrest on suspicion of battery.

ai_summary: Rapper Lil Nas X was arrested in Los Angeles after an incident.
He was found walking in his underwear on a street.
Police allege he charged at officers and punched one.
He was taken to the hospital after the arrest.
The incident led to his arrest on suspicion of battery.

items.title: Musk Tried to Enlist Zuckerberg to Help Finance Bid for OpenAI
items.standfirst: Elon Musk tried to enlist Mark Zuckerberg for his unsolicited bid to buy OpenAI this year, the startup said in a court filing.
items.content: Elon Musk tried to enlist Mark Zuckerberg for his unsolicited bid to buy OpenAI this year, the startup said in a court filing.

The bid was unsolicited by OpenAI.

clusters.title: Newsom approves California November vote to counter Texas Republican redistricting
clusters.neutral_headline: Newsom approves California November vote to counter Texas Republican redistricting

items.title: Newsom approves California November vote to counter Texas Republican redistricting
items.standfirst: California voters will decide in November on a Democrat-proposed congressional map aiming to secure five more US House seats. This follows Texas Republicans advancing a map for similar GOP gains. Governor Gavin Newsom signed the legislation, escalating a national partisan gerrymandering battle ahead of the midterms.
items.content: California voters will decide in November on a Democrat-proposed congressional map aiming to secure five more US House seats. This follows Texas Republicans advancing a map for similar GOP gains. Governor Gavin Newsom signed the legislation, escalating a national partisan gerrymandering battle ahead of the midterms.

items.title: Newsom signs bill putting new California congressional maps on November ballot
items.standfirst: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has signed a bill that will allow voters to decide on new congressional maps in November. CBS News reporter Erica Brown has more.
items.content: California Gov. Gavin Newsom has signed a bill that will allow voters to decide on new congressional maps in November. CBS News reporter Erica Brown has more.

items.title: Newsom approves California November vote to counter Texas Republican redistricting
items.standfirst: California voters will decide in November on a Democrat-proposed congressional map aiming to secure five more US House seats. This follows Texas Republicans advancing a map for similar GOP gains. Governor Gavin Newsom signed the legislation, escalating a national partisan gerrymandering battle ahead of the midterms.
items.content: California voters will decide in November on a Democrat-proposed congressional map aiming to secure five more US House seats. This follows Texas Republicans advancing a map for similar GOP gains. Governor Gavin Newsom signed the legislation, escalating a national partisan gerrymandering battle ahead of the midterms.

ai_summary: California voters will decide on new congressional maps in November.
The maps aim to secure five more US House seats for Democrats.
This follows Texas Republicans advancing a map for similar GOP gains.
Governor Newsom signed the legislation, escalating a partisan battle.
The battle is ahead of the upcoming midterm elections.

clusters.title: Ukrainian national arrested over 2022 Nord Stream pipeline blasts
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukrainian national arrested over 2022 Nord Stream pipeline blasts

items.title: Ukrainian national arrested over 2022 Nord Stream pipeline blasts
items.standfirst: Italian authorities have arrested a Ukrainian national suspected of coordinating and taking part in the 2022 sabotage of Nord Stream gas pipelines. The suspect, identified only as Serhii K., was arrested overnight in Italy’s Rimini province, at the request of German federal prosecutors. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.
items.content: Italian authorities have arrested a Ukrainian national suspected of coordinating and taking part in the 2022 sabotage of Nord Stream gas pipelines. The suspect, identified only as Serhii K., was arrested overnight in Italy’s Rimini province, at the request of German federal prosecutors. FRANCE 24's Monte Francis reports.

items.title: Ukrainian arrested in Italy over Nord Stream attacks, German prosecutors say
items.standfirst: Italian police have arrested a Ukrainian man suspected of coordinating attacks on the Nord Stream pipelines, Germany's prosecutor general said on Thursday.
items.content: Italian police have arrested a Ukrainian man suspected of coordinating attacks on the Nord Stream pipelines, Germany's prosecutor general said on Thursday.

ai_summary: Italian authorities arrested a Ukrainian national.
The suspect is linked to the 2022 Nord Stream pipeline sabotage.
The arrest occurred in Italy's Rimini province.
The arrest was at the request of German federal prosecutors.
The suspect's identity is known only as Serhii K.
